page.title: 11Transport in Collingham
page.content: The{railway station }was built in 1846 enabling passengers to travel to Lincoln and through to Grimsby or to Nottingham and on to Crewe.It is still a very busy line and well used by many of the village people.The fare from Collingham to Newark Castle station is 60p. There are local{bus services}to Newark Lincoln and Nottingham and there is even a bus from Lincoln to Manchester which calls in at Collingham.A small bus company is based in the village, hiring out to schools and clubs and running holiday tours both at home and abroad. But of course it is the{car}which is most used.86% of families have a car, 28% of those having two cars.There are four servicing garages.Petrol is{Â£2.04 per gallon.
